what I was doing because I didn't notice the error until next time I looked at 
the log. The platform and severity of this should probably be changed.

I got the same thing with build i0328:0800.

Not sure when the exception happened, but I was doing the following:

- create simple project
- used WinZip to extract files into the project content area on the file system
- in the Navigator I hit refresh
- then I closed the project and re-opened it

Now that I think about it I had something similar before. Here it is. See bug
42176. If you had a file in the copy buffer and then performed an open/close you
got the same stack. 

Is this a duplicate?
Updating to P2 as we now have 3 instances of this particular bug.
*** Bug 56381 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 58365 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Bug 58365 has a reproducible test case for this problem.
The code that creates this Clipboard is now deleted.
